1use std::{cell::RefCell, pin::Pin, ptr::NonNull, rc::Rc};
2
3use anyhow::{anyhow, Result};
4use intrusive_collections::{intrusive_adapter, LinkedList, LinkedListLink};
5use thiserror::Error;
6
7#[cfg(test)]
8use crate::storage::mkvs::cache::CacheStats;
9use crate::storage::mkvs::{
10    cache::{Cache, CacheExtra, CacheItem, ReadSyncFetcher},
11    sync::{merge_verified_subtree, ProofVerifier, ReadSync},
12    tree::{
13        Depth, InternalNode, Key, LeafNode, NodeBox, NodeKind, NodePointer, NodePtrRef, NodeRef,
14        Root, RootType, Value,
15    },
16};
17
18#[derive(Error, Debug)]
19#[error("mkvs: tried to remove locked node")]
20struct RemoveLockedError;
21
22#[derive(Clone, Default)]
23pub struct CacheItemBox<Item: CacheItem + Default> {
24    item: Rc<RefCell<Item>>,
25    link: LinkedListLink,
26}
27
28intrusive_adapter!(
29    CacheItemAdapter<Item> = Pin<Box<CacheItemBox<Item>>>:
30        CacheItemBox<Item> { link: LinkedListLink }
31        where Item: CacheItem + Default
32);
33
34struct LRUList<V>
35where
36    V: CacheItem + Default,
37{
38    pub list: LinkedList<CacheItemAdapter<V>>,
39    pub size: usize,
40    pub capacity: usize,
41    pub mark: CacheExtra<V>,
42}
43
44impl<V> LRUList<V>
45where
46    V: CacheItem + Default,
47{
48    pub fn new(capacity: usize) -> LRUList<V> {
49        LRUList {
50            list: LinkedList::new(CacheItemAdapter::new()),
51            size: 0,
52            capacity,
53            mark: None,
54        }
55    }
56
57    fn mark(&mut self) {
58        self.mark = self.list.front().get().map(|front| {
59            front
60                .item
61                .borrow()
62                .get_cache_extra()
63                .expect("item was just retrieved from list, cache extra must exist")
64        });
65    }
66
67    fn add(&mut self, val: Rc<RefCell<V>>) {
68        let mut val_ref = val.borrow_mut();
69        if val_ref.get_cache_extra().is_none() {
70            self.size += val_ref.get_cached_size();
71            let mut item_box = Box::pin(CacheItemBox {
72                item: val.clone(),
73                link: LinkedListLink::new(),
74            });
75            val_ref.set_cache_extra(NonNull::new(&mut *item_box));
76            if let Some(non_null_pos) = &self.mark {
77                let mut pos_cursor =
78                    unsafe { self.list.cursor_mut_from_ptr(non_null_pos.as_ptr()) };
79                pos_cursor.insert_after(item_box);
80            } else {
81                self.list.push_front(item_box);
82            }
83        } else {
84            self.use_val(val.clone());
85        }
86    }
87
88    fn use_val(&mut self, val: Rc<RefCell<V>>) -> bool {
89        let val_ref = val.borrow();
90        match val_ref.get_cache_extra() {
91            None => false,
92            Some(non_null) => {
93                let mut item_cursor = unsafe { self.list.cursor_mut_from_ptr(non_null.as_ptr()) };
94                let removed_box = item_cursor.remove().unwrap();
95                self.list.push_front(removed_box);
96                true
97            }
98        }
99    }
100
101    fn remove(&mut self, val: Rc<RefCell<V>>) -> bool {
102        let extra = val.borrow().get_cache_extra();
103        match extra {
104            None => false,
105            Some(non_null) => {
106                if let Some(non_null_mark) = self.mark {
107                    if non_null.as_ptr() == non_null_mark.as_ptr() {
108                        self.mark = None;
109                    }
110                }
111
112                let mut item_cursor = unsafe { self.list.cursor_mut_from_ptr(non_null.as_ptr()) };
113                match item_cursor.remove() {
114                    None => false,
115                    Some(item_box) => {
116                        let mut val = item_box.item.borrow_mut();
117                        val.set_cache_extra(None);
118                        self.size -= val.get_cached_size();
119                        true
120                    }
121                }
122            }
123        }
124    }
125
126    fn evict_for_val(
127        &mut self,
128        val: Rc<RefCell<V>>,
129        locked_val: Option<&Rc<RefCell<V>>>,
130    ) -> Result<Vec<Rc<RefCell<V>>>, RemoveLockedError> {
131        let mut evicted: Vec<Rc<RefCell<V>>> = Vec::new();
132        if self.capacity > 0 {
133            let target_size = val.borrow().get_cached_size();
134            while !self.list.is_empty() && self.size + target_size > self.capacity {
135                let back = self.list.back().get().unwrap().item.clone();
136                if let Some(locked_val) = locked_val {
137                    if back.as_ptr() == locked_val.as_ptr() {
138                        return Err(RemoveLockedError);
139                    }
140                }
141                if self.remove(back.clone()) {
142                    evicted.push(back);
143                }
144            }
145        }
146        Ok(evicted)
147    }
148}
149
150/// Cache implementation with a simple LRU eviction strategy.
151pub struct LRUCache {
152    read_syncer: Box<dyn ReadSync>,
153
154    pending_root: NodePtrRef,
155    sync_root: Root,
156
157    lru_leaf: LRUList<NodePointer>,
158    lru_internal: LRUList<NodePointer>,
159}
160
161impl LRUCache {
162    /// Construct a new cache instance.
163    ///
164    /// * `node_capacity` is the maximum number of internal nodes held by the
165    ///   cache before eviction.
166    /// * `value_capacity` is the total size, in bytes, of values held
167    ///   by the cache before eviction.
168    /// * `read_syncer` is the read syncer used as backing for the cache.
169    pub fn new(
170        node_capacity: usize,
171        value_capacity: usize,
172        read_syncer: Box<dyn ReadSync>,
173        root_type: RootType,
174    ) -> Box<LRUCache> {
175        Box::new(LRUCache {
176            read_syncer,
177
178            pending_root: Rc::new(RefCell::new(NodePointer {
179                node: None,
180                ..Default::default()
181            })),
182            sync_root: Root {
183                root_type,
184                ..Default::default()
185            },
186
187            lru_leaf: LRUList::new(value_capacity),
188            lru_internal: LRUList::new(node_capacity),
189        })
190    }
191
192    fn new_internal_node_ptr(&mut self, node: Option<NodeRef>) -> NodePtrRef {
193        Rc::new(RefCell::new(NodePointer {
194            node,
195            ..Default::default()
196        }))
197    }
198
199    fn new_leaf_node_ptr(&mut self, node: Option<NodeRef>) -> NodePtrRef {
200        Rc::new(RefCell::new(NodePointer {
201            node,
202            ..Default::default()
203        }))
204    }
205
206    fn try_commit_node(
207        &mut self,
208        ptr: NodePtrRef,
209        locked_ptr: Option<&NodePtrRef>,
210    ) -> Result<(), RemoveLockedError> {
211        assert!(ptr.borrow().clean, "mkvs: commit_node called on dirty node");
212        if ptr.borrow().node.is_none() {
213            return Ok(());
214        }
215        if self.use_node(ptr.clone()) {
216            return Ok(());
217        }
218
219        match classify_noderef!(? ptr.borrow().node) {
220            NodeKind::Internal => {
221                let evicted = self.lru_internal.evict_for_val(ptr.clone(), locked_ptr)?;
222                for node in evicted {
223                    self.try_remove_node(node.clone(), locked_ptr)?;
224                }
225                self.lru_internal.add(ptr);
226            }
227            NodeKind::Leaf => {
228                let evicted = self.lru_leaf.evict_for_val(ptr.clone(), locked_ptr)?;
229                for node in evicted {
230                    self.try_remove_node(node.clone(), locked_ptr)?;
231                }
232                self.lru_leaf.add(ptr);
233            }
234            NodeKind::None => return Ok(()),
235        };
236
237        Ok(())
238    }
239
240    fn try_remove_node(
241        &mut self,
242        ptr: NodePtrRef,
243        locked_ptr: Option<&NodePtrRef>,
244    ) -> Result<(), RemoveLockedError> {
245        #[derive(Clone, Copy)]
246        enum VisitState {
247            Unvisited,
248            VisitedLeaf,
249            VisitedLeft,
250            VisitedRight,
251        }
252        #[derive(Clone)]
253        struct PendingNode(NodePtrRef, VisitState);
254
255        let mut stack: Vec<PendingNode> = vec![PendingNode(ptr, VisitState::Unvisited)];
256        'stack: while !stack.is_empty() {
257            let top_idx = stack.len() - 1;
258            let top = stack[top_idx].clone();
259
260            if let Some(locked_ptr) = locked_ptr {
261                if locked_ptr.as_ptr() == top.0.as_ptr() {
262                    return Err(RemoveLockedError);
263                }
264            }
265
266            // Perform removal in depth-first order. We do not remove the node from
267            // the stack until all of its subtrees have been fully removed.
268            if let Some(ref node_ref) = top.0.borrow().node {
269                if let NodeBox::Internal(ref n) = *node_ref.borrow() {
270                    match top.1 {
271                        VisitState::Unvisited => {
272                            stack[top_idx].1 = VisitState::VisitedLeaf;
273                            stack.push(PendingNode(n.leaf_node.clone(), VisitState::Unvisited));
274                            continue 'stack;
275                        }
276                        VisitState::VisitedLeaf => {
277                            stack[top_idx].1 = VisitState::VisitedLeft;
278                            stack.push(PendingNode(n.left.clone(), VisitState::Unvisited));
279                            continue 'stack;
280                        }
281                        VisitState::VisitedLeft => {
282                            stack[top_idx].1 = VisitState::VisitedRight;
283                            stack.push(PendingNode(n.right.clone(), VisitState::Unvisited));
284                            continue 'stack;
285                        }
286                        VisitState::VisitedRight => {
287                            // Now it can finally be removed.
288                        }
289                    }
290                }
291            }
292
293            stack.pop();
294
295            match classify_noderef!(? top.0.borrow().node) {
296                NodeKind::Internal => {
297                    self.lru_internal.remove(top.0.clone());
298                    top.0.borrow_mut().node = None;
299                }
300                NodeKind::Leaf => {
301                    self.lru_leaf.remove(top.0.clone());
302                    top.0.borrow_mut().node = None;
303                }
304                NodeKind::None => {}
305            }
306        }
307
308        Ok(())
309    }
310
311    fn commit_merged_node(
312        &mut self,
313        ptr: NodePtrRef,
314        locked_ptr: &NodePtrRef,
315    ) -> Result<(), RemoveLockedError> {
316        // Try to commit the node. If we fail this means that there is not enough
317        // space in the cache to keep the node that we are trying to dereference.
318        if let Err(error) = self.try_commit_node(ptr.clone(), Some(locked_ptr)) {
319            // Failed to commit, make sure to not keep the subtree in memory.
320            ptr.borrow_mut().node = None;
321            return Err(error);
322        }
323
324        // Commit all children.
325        match classify_noderef!(? ptr.borrow().node) {
326            NodeKind::Internal => {
327                let node_ref = ptr.borrow().get_node();
328                self.commit_merged_node(noderef_as!(node_ref, Internal).left.clone(), locked_ptr)?;
329                self.commit_merged_node(noderef_as!(node_ref, Internal).right.clone(), locked_ptr)?;
330            }
331            NodeKind::Leaf => {}
332            NodeKind::None => {}
333        }
334
335        Ok(())
336    }
337}
338
339impl Cache for LRUCache {
340    #[cfg(test)]
341    fn stats(&self) -> CacheStats {
342        CacheStats {
343            internal_node_count: self.lru_internal.size,
344            leaf_value_size: self.lru_leaf.size,
345        }
346    }
347
348    fn get_pending_root(&self) -> NodePtrRef {
349        self.pending_root.clone()
350    }
351
352    fn set_pending_root(&mut self, new_root: NodePtrRef) {
353        self.pending_root = new_root;
354    }
355
356    fn set_sync_root(&mut self, root: Root) {
357        self.sync_root = root;
358    }
359
360    #[cfg(test)]
361    fn get_read_syncer(&self) -> &Box<dyn ReadSync> {
362        &self.read_syncer
363    }
364
365    fn new_internal_node(
366        &mut self,
367        label: &Key,
368        label_bit_length: Depth,
369        leaf_node: NodePtrRef,
370        left: NodePtrRef,
371        right: NodePtrRef,
372    ) -> NodePtrRef {
373        let node = Rc::new(RefCell::new(NodeBox::Internal(InternalNode {
374            label: label.clone(),
375            label_bit_length,
376            leaf_node,
377            left,
378            right,
379            ..Default::default()
380        })));
381        self.new_internal_node_ptr(Some(node))
382    }
383
384    fn new_leaf_node(&mut self, key: &Key, value: Value) -> NodePtrRef {
385        let node = Rc::new(RefCell::new(NodeBox::Leaf(LeafNode {
386            key: key.clone(),
387            value,
388            ..Default::default()
389        })));
390        self.new_leaf_node_ptr(Some(node))
391    }
392
393    fn remove_node(&mut self, ptr: NodePtrRef) {
394        self.try_remove_node(ptr, None)
395            .expect("no locked pointer passed, cannot fail");
396    }
397
398    fn deref_node_ptr<F: ReadSyncFetcher>(
399        &mut self,
400        ptr: NodePtrRef,
401        fetcher: Option<F>,
402    ) -> Result<Option<NodeRef>> {
403        let ptr_ref = ptr;
404        let ptr = ptr_ref.borrow();
405
406        self.use_node(ptr_ref.clone());
407
408        if let Some(ref node) = &ptr.node {
409            let refetch = match *node.borrow() {
410                NodeBox::Internal(ref n) => {
411                    // If this is an internal node, check if the leaf node  has been evicted.
412                    // In this case treat it as if we need to re-fetch the node.
413                    let leaf_ptr = n.leaf_node.borrow();
414                    !leaf_ptr.is_null() && leaf_ptr.node.is_none()
415                }
416                NodeBox::Leaf(..) => false,
417            };
418
419            if refetch {
420                drop(ptr);
421                self.remove_node(ptr_ref.clone());
422            } else {
423                return Ok(Some(node.clone()));
424            }
425        } else {
426            if !ptr.clean || ptr.is_null() {
427                return Ok(None);
428            }
429            drop(ptr);
430        }
431
432        // Node not available locally, fetch from read syncer.
433        if let Some(fetcher) = fetcher {
434            self.remote_sync(ptr_ref.clone(), fetcher)?;
435        } else {
436            return Err(anyhow!(
437                "mkvs: node to dereference not available locally and no fetcher provided"
438            ));
439        }
440
441        let ptr = ptr_ref.borrow();
442        if ptr.node.is_none() {
443            return Err(anyhow!(
444                "mkvs: received result did not contain node (or cache too small)"
445            ));
446        }
447        Ok(ptr.node.clone())
448    }
449
450    fn remote_sync<F: ReadSyncFetcher>(&mut self, ptr: NodePtrRef, fetcher: F) -> Result<()> {
451        let proof = fetcher.fetch(self.sync_root, ptr.clone(), &mut self.read_syncer)?;
452
453        // The proof can be for one of two hashes: i) it is either for ptr.Hash in case
454        // all the nodes are only contained in the subtree below ptr, or ii) it is for
455        // the c.syncRoot.Hash in case it contains nodes outside the subtree.
456        let ptr_hash = ptr.borrow().hash;
457        let (dst_ptr, expected_root) = if proof.untrusted_root == ptr_hash {
458            (ptr.clone(), ptr_hash)
459        } else if proof.untrusted_root == self.sync_root.hash {
460            (self.pending_root.clone(), self.sync_root.hash)
461        } else {
462            return Err(anyhow!(
463                "mkvs: got proof for unexpected root ({:?})",
464                proof.untrusted_root
465            ));
466        };
467
468        // Verify proof.
469        let pv = ProofVerifier;
470        let subtree = pv.verify_proof(expected_root, &proof)?;
471
472        // Merge resulting nodes.
473        let mut merged_nodes: Vec<NodePtrRef> = Vec::new();
474        merge_verified_subtree(dst_ptr, subtree, &mut merged_nodes)?;
475        let mut remove = false;
476        for node_ref in merged_nodes {
477            if remove {
478                // Do not keep subtrees that we failed to commit in memory.
479                node_ref.borrow_mut().node = None;
480            }
481
482            if let Err(RemoveLockedError) = self.commit_merged_node(node_ref, &ptr) {
483                // Cache is too small, ignore.
484                remove = true;
485            }
486        }
487
488        Ok(())
489    }
490
491    fn use_node(&mut self, ptr: NodePtrRef) -> bool {
492        match classify_noderef!(? ptr.borrow().node) {
493            NodeKind::Internal => self.lru_internal.use_val(ptr),
494            NodeKind::Leaf => self.lru_leaf.use_val(ptr),
495            NodeKind::None => false,
496        }
497    }
498
499    fn commit_node(&mut self, ptr: NodePtrRef) {
500        self.try_commit_node(ptr, None)
501            .expect("no locked pointer passed, cannot fail");
502    }
503
504    fn rollback_node(&mut self, ptr: NodePtrRef, kind: NodeKind) {
505        if ptr.borrow().get_cache_extra().is_none() {
506            // Node has not yet been committed to cache.
507            return;
508        }
509
510        let lru = match kind {
511            NodeKind::Internal => &mut self.lru_internal,
512            NodeKind::Leaf => &mut self.lru_leaf,
513            NodeKind::None => panic!("lru_cache: rollback works only for Internal and Leaf nodes!"),
514        };
515        lru.remove(ptr.clone());
516
517        ptr.borrow_mut().set_cache_extra(None);
518    }
519
520    fn mark_position(&mut self) {
521        self.lru_internal.mark();
522        self.lru_leaf.mark();
523    }
524}
